body_html:
Changing expected_log_prob to expected_log_prob[0] here https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/test_distributions.py#L361 fixes it for me, though I still get some overflow warnings:

RuntimeWarning: overflow encountered in exp
  return np.exp(self._logpdf(x, a))

I don't know if this fix is appropriate.
No problem :-), CI should catch such things, hence my issue is about CI, not about a particular PR.
body_text:
Changing expected_log_prob to expected_log_prob[0] here https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/test_distributions.py#L361 fixes it for me, though I still get some overflow warnings:
RuntimeWarning: overflow encountered in exp
  return np.exp(self._logpdf(x, a))

I don't know if this fix is appropriate.
No problem :-), CI should catch such things, hence my issue is about CI, not about a particular PR.
body:
Changing ```expected_log_prob``` to ```expected_log_prob[0]``` here https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/test_distributions.py#L361 fixes it for me, though I still get some overflow warnings:
```
RuntimeWarning: overflow encountered in exp
  return np.exp(self._logpdf(x, a))
```
I don't know if this fix is appropriate. 
No problem :-), CI should catch such things, hence my issue is about CI, not about a particular PR.
